revised_title: The Influence of Refraction and Altitude on Barometer Readings
tldr: Dr. Nettleton conducted experiments to understand the relationship between the height of the barometer and elevation above sea level. He found that refraction affects the accuracy of barometer readings at higher altitudes, making it difficult to determine the true height of a location. He also discovered that the density of the air decreases with elevation, and he developed a method to calculate the required elevation to achieve a specific barometer reading.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
